comments: The compositions of n in which each natural number is colored by one of  p different colors are called p-colored compositions of n. For n>=1, a(n) equals the number of 39-colored compositions of n such that no adjacent parts have the same color. - Milan Janjic, Nov 17 2011
links: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..100
Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (39).
formula: G.f.: 1/(1-39*x). [From _Philippe Del√©ham_, Nov 24 2008]a(n)=39^n; a(n)=39*a(n-1) a(0)=1 [From Vincenzo Librandi, Nov 21 2010]
prog: (MAGMA)[39^n: n in [0..20]] [From Vincenzo Librandi, Nov 21 2010](PARI) a(n)=39^n \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Nov 18 2011
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
